page.title: 16Ashchurch Church
page.content: Opposite to our school is the Parish Church of St. Nicholas, Ashchurch, which was begun about 1150 A.D. A large porch was added in Tudor times. Inside the church there is a long thin nave with outward sloping walls which remind one of a ship.The chancel is separated from the nave by an wooden rood screen.On the north side of the nave, a row of arches shows where the original wall was before the church was enlarged. In the church there is an organ which came from the Manor House at Fiddington.Years ago the walls were covered with bright pictures.Before the present church was built there was a Saxon church on the same site. There are still some of the original stones surviving today such as a carved fish and some herringbone masonry.Even in summer you can feel very cold in the church.
